alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 29 at 1:57AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM HST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 500 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 153 AM HST, radar and rain gages indicated heavy rainfall along the Hamakua Coast and over the lower Puna District. Rain rates were 1 to 2 inches per hour near Laupahoehoe and Pahoa. Additional rainfall is expected to move onshore over the next several hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hilo, Hawaiian Paradise Park, Kapaau, Honokaa, Honomu, Papaikou, Pepeekeo, Hakalau, Ninole, Laupahoehoe, Mountain View, Ookala, Keaau, Glenwood, Volcano, Paauilo, Hawaiian Acres, Orchidland Estates and Pahoa. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 500 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. Rainfall and runoff will also cause hazardous driving conditions due to ponding, reduced visibility and poor braking action. A Flood Watch is also in effect for Hawaii County until 6 PM HST Sunday.
